level.text: The hearing examiner shall encourage settlement at every stage of the proceeding, if settlement is consistent with the provisions and objectives of the Act.
The parties shall submit any settlement agreement to the hearing examiner in writing or orally on the record.
If the parties agree to settle the case, the hearing examiner shall issue an order setting forth the terms of the settlement and closing the case.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 38 DCR 2034 (April 5, 1991); as amended by 54 DCR 6020 (June 22, 2007).
